title: Enable indexing for existing tenants
content:
When you see slow database query performance on the Audit page load, please follow the below steps to introduce the indexes for a specific tenant. To enable indexing in the audit database for existing tenants, you can run queries. Open the query tool for the required schema under the audit table and run the following queries for each column. Run these queries only if the existing tenant has data. The indexing in a fresh tenant or an existing tenant that doesn't have data is done through the code:

CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS AUDIT_ACTION ON "<schema>".audit (action);
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS AUDIT_TIME ON "<schema>".audit (audit_time);
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS AUDIT_EVENT_CATEGORY "<schema>".audit (event_category);
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS AUDIT_RESULT ON "<schema>".audit (result);

<schema>: The schema for which you want to enable indexing.

For example:

CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS AUDIT_ACTION ON "SYSBO".audit audit (action);
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS AUDIT_TIME ON "SYSBO".audit (audit_time);
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS AUDIT_EVENT_CATEGORY "SYSBO".audit (event_category);
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS AUDIT_RESULT ON "SYSBO".audit (result);
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS AUDIT_TENANT_ID ON "SYSBO".audit(tenant_id);

Drop unused composite indexes

You can drop an existing composite index (an index with multiple key columns) for a table by using this query:

DROP INDEX AUDIT_INDEX ON "<schema>".audit

Example:

DROP INDEX audit_index ON "SYSBO".audit
